title: GH2022
author: GH2022
content: Hello all, new user here in peace.I am trying to see if it is possible to raise $100 of Bitcoin by just doing advertising or promotional work for people.I recently came across a website which said that they would pay up to $20 for writing a few paragraphs worth of positive reviews and promotions, but having contacted them they've not (as yet) replied - therefore I'm also trying to work out which sites are legitimate and will pay out and which ones are fake.Whilst I could just donate the equivalent sum, I like a challenge and also to see if it can be done and is possible.If anybody knows of any businesses which will pay out a small amount of Bitcoin for doing advertising or promotional work for them, can they please let me know in the replies.  If a job will pay $15-$20 worth of Bitcoin per time, I'd be very interested.I will donate the $100 to charity as well - I don't intend keeping it and I'll convert the Bitcoin to USD $ I appreciate it's a weird request, but I'm looking to do something fun and to challenge myself for a good cause - can I get Bitcoin by doing advertising and promotional work and use the amount raised to help a good cause?Many Thanks!

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: If you just doing it for fun while giving service to someone who hires you then you're so kind.If you are looking for a job or business that looking for someone who can promote or advertise their business why not try the services section you can maybe find someone there who can hire your service. Check the section below and create a new thread that includes your service- https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=52.0

comments.author: Latviand
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on June 19, 2023, 11:53:23 PMIf you just doing it for fun while giving service to someone who hires you then you're so kind.If you are looking for a job or business that looking for someone who can promote or advertise their business why not try the services section you can maybe find someone there who can hire your service. Check the section below and create a new thread that includes your service- https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=52.0That's a good recommendation although I don't think that OP will ever get a job there, he's a newbie and the people posting in the Service board is too picky and fuzzy to hire him unless OP's got an astronomical resume, OP can still try though, maybe someone will give OP a chance. To OP, make sure that when someone hires you, you need to make sure that you get paid especially if the person that hired you isn't a prominent member in the forum, wouldn't want you wasting your work then getting paid nothing.

comments.author: Fundamentals Of
comments.body: So, in short, you work for charity? Why not then advertise or promote for free those good causes that you really want to help? That's a rather direct way of helping those good causes. Why not volunteer your time and effort to these good causes? You're not after Bitcoin anyway because you're planning to convert it to USD and even donate it. If you want to raise funds, I think these charities have also fundraising events. You might want to take a look at their schedules.

comments.body: Quote from: GH2022 on June 19, 2023, 10:34:25 PMHello all, new user here in peace.I am trying to see if it is possible to raise $100 of Bitcoin by just doing advertising or promotional work for people.you can do other things to accumulate 100$ and convert it to bitcoin meaning it doesn't need to be here in crypto forum .QuoteI recently came across a website which said that they would pay up to $20 for writing a few paragraphs worth of positive reviews and promotions, with all of these promises? sorry to say but it is either a scam site or a shilling method to earn and let others to believe in wrong  things , please stay away in this kind.Quotebut having contacted them they've not (as yet) replied - therefore I'm also trying to work out which sites are legitimate and will pay out and which ones are fake.what ever they respond on you? please believe nothing mate.QuoteWhilst I could just donate the equivalent sum, I like a challenge and also to see if it can be done and is possible.QuoteI will donate the $100 to charity as well - I don't intend keeping it and I'll convert the Bitcoin to USD $ I appreciate it's a weird request, but I'm looking to do something fun and to challenge myself for a good cause - can I get Bitcoin by doing advertising and promotional work and use the amount raised to help a good cause?Many Thanks!Not sure if i am going to believe these claims because if you truly wanted to donate for a cause ? then you have done this with your money on hand and not to seek in internet like this because this will take time to materialized .

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: GH2022 on June 19, 2023, 10:34:25 PMI recently came across a website which said that they would pay up to $20 for writing a few paragraphs worth of positive reviews and promotions, but having contacted them they've not (as yet) replied - therefore I'm also trying to work out which sites are legitimate and will pay out and which ones are fake.Don't engage in such things. You're basically helping them to scam people. Even if legit, $20 is way too much for tasks that can be done with bots. I've seen similar tasks being paid for $5/100 reviews on other websites. If you want to find a job with low requirements for this charity thing, try to apply for a rater position or something similar. If you want to make money here, you need some time and effort so that you can at least rank up to a decent rank. Don't know if your goal has a time limit or not, but if you want to, you can try to contribute here and look for opportunities in the future.Edit: I just saw your other thread. Just a suggestion,  if you want to promote that donation organization you can also put their link on your profile info.

comments.author: GreatArkansas
comments.body: Quote from: GH2022 on June 19, 2023, 10:34:25 PMI appreciate it's a weird request, but I'm looking to do something fun and to challenge myself for a good cause - can I get Bitcoin by doing advertising and promotional work and use the amount raised to help a good cause?Yes for me, as long as it's not fishy and you are not taking advantage of people, you will do it fairly and transparently.Because a lot of people still don't know Bitcoin and some of their first impressions of Bitcoin is a scam or Ponzi. So first, explain how Bitcoin works and what is really your goal, and be transparent.There are a lot of ways to earn Bitcoin by doing these some advertising or promotional work, some are called "offer walls" where your reward could be in the form of Bitcoin.

comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: I admire your intent to be doing something for charity purposes and I am sure that soon you can find a way to make it. Here in this forum there is a section for people offering services so maybe you can look for that also. Now, we also have many freelancing sites you can explore. Just be careful with some programs offering you some form of a "job" but is actually a paid program false marketed as a job opportunity.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Quote from: GH2022 on June 19, 2023, 10:34:25 PMIf anybody knows of any businesses which will pay out a small amount of Bitcoin for doing advertising or promotional work for them, can they please let me know in the replies.  If a job will pay $15-$20 worth of Bitcoin per time, I'd be very interested.If am to get your whole idea here, you're interested in a charity act but don't have the money or means to make such donation and needs a job that can pay you some certain amount in bitcoin in other to help you accomplish your ambition, the first question to ask yourself too is that what can you offer that the people can have a take on and pay for your value or service rendered to them, additional to this, try check the service board, you may get some offers there.Quote from: GH2022 on June 19, 2023, 10:34:25 PMI will donate the $100 to charity as well - I don't intend keeping it and I'll convert the Bitcoin to USD $This one is left to your choice, you owe no one responsible for giving an account of what you use the money for since it's your hard earned money, you may only decided to share with us here about the progress in it so far so others could learn something from such experience.

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: Everything is possible, raising $100 in Bitcoin for Charity is possible and even more, if you start providing services to the audience or Freelancing.You will be able to earn more than that and I am not sure, why you decided to give it all to charity, feels like you want a point to start earning and then keep it once the income flow starts.Nevertheless, you can provide service to those who need and you will surely be able to earn money in BTC.

comments.author: knowngunman
comments.body: Quote from: GH2022 on June 19, 2023, 10:34:25 PMI will donate the $100 to charity as well - I don't intend keeping it and I'll convert the Bitcoin to USD $ Donating to charity is a thing of choice and not compulsory so why stressing yourself if you don't have the means yet? Do you think by mentioning charity people will start patronizing your service without considering your qualifications? Do not put burden on yourself to make charity donation when you are still struggling to make ends meet. Work and earn in order to improve yourself first before thinking of charity.Quote from: kotajikikox on June 20, 2023, 01:40:10 AMwith all of these promises? sorry to say but it is either a scam site or a shilling method to earn and let others to believe in wrong  things , please stay away in this kind.It's very possible. Participating in bounty especially article writing can earn you that but only if your article is accepted by the manager. The issue is that some project will refuse to pay at the end of the campaign while some will not pay up to the agreed bounty pool and thereby leaving the hunters with a penny rewards. Reliability is not guaranteed thou but don't be in haste to tag it scam when you have no evidence.

comments.author: btc78
comments.body: You have a good heart and has a best way of helping , but it will be best if not mentioning about where the funds will go because it only shows another plans of making the thread and the goodness of your intention is being questioned.and also I see that you have created multiple post about finding job , is this really for funding in that donation or something that for your bread and butter?

comments.author: mendace
comments.body: Doing charity workforce is a great idea, you could try to create a thread where you offer yourself for some service in exchange for some satoshi, or you can contact some company that operates on Bitcoin and ask if they need some kind of service that you can provide .  I still wish you good luck

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: @OP since you've said that you'll just even convert Bitcoin into USD then why not just look for those freelance marketplaces where you can sell your services and get some $ for tasks that you'll do to the clients?These basically are the freelancing websites where you can find some work and get paid later after fulfilling it and then just donate the money you'll earn from doing those.UpworkFiverr

comments.author: michellee
comments.body: I advise you to find a job on freelancer sites. I saw that thousands of workers offered their skills and many of them already earn a lot of money. But to get new clients, you really have to convince them that you are the person they are looking for.In addition, you need to have a portfolio of the work you have done so that this will make potential clients aware of your potential. Or you can make video tutorials and upload them to Youtube or other media sites that will pay you for the ads that appear in each of your videos.I think you have to be able to find out what your passion is because if it's only based on all of our suggestions, you can get bored and have no interest in trying them one by one from what we suggest.

comments.author: icalical
comments.body: If you want to earn money from this forum, then you need to rank up first, make a good post and get some merits, then join a campaign. If you got some skills and portfolio you can offer it to people in this forum too, create a thread about your service in this section https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=52.0, Outside of this forum there are also some freelancing platform that paid in crypto like https://cryptotask.org/ and https://laborx.com/, they paid in altcoin tho, but you can use exchange to trade it for bitcoin later.
